Key Match Events: Toronto Raptors lost by 30 points to the Cleveland Cavaliers, breaking a record as the worst season opener result in franchise history.
In the second quarter, the team was outscored 36-17 and committed more turnovers than they made shots.
Pre-Game Insights: Toronto Raptors kick off NBA season with home opener against Cavaliers, Vince Carter to debut as broadcaster
Post-Match Reflections: Boucher said, 'Raptors losing by 30 in honour of their 30th anniversary is truly poetic.'
Boucher mentioned it was good for the team to realize the season has started and they have to play harder.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chris Boucher led the team in scoring with 18 points, while second-year Raptors player Gradey Dick hit 16.
Evan Mobley scored 25 points for the Cavaliers.
The final score of the game was 136-106.
